content.description: Climb straight up the front left side to the top.  Crux if you want to call one, is just past middle.  Many ways up, all about the same.
content.location: Boulder 1, Front left (tall side) of boulder facing parking.  Downclimb the angled side on the right.

content.description:
Straight up, no need to deviate back and forth.  The line is straight forward.  High stepping, and looking for ledges for the feet, or going for the nubs if you want to make it harder. 

  Taller than it looks once you are on it.
content.location: Boulder 2.  Frontside middle.  Downclimb the backside boulder stack carefully.

content.description: Climb the rightmost side of the backside to the top.  The crux is getting through the slick top area, but that is exactly why you climb it.  The top makes this problem.
content.location: Boulder 1.  backside right.  Climb down the obvious front side.

content.description: Many ways up in the middle of the backside of boulder 1.
content.location: Boulder 1.  Backside middle.  Climb down the front.

content.description: Climb straight up with about 5 moves.  The crux is near the top.  The route is a straight line down from the tallest part.
content.location: Boulder 1, Backside left (near sidewalk).  The start is the bucket pinches.

content.description: The two boulders that frame the walkway.  Boulder on the Right facing away from the parking lot is boulder 1.  Boulder on the left is boulder 2.
